item.title: 尽管有绿色目标，中国仍在推进能源安全中拥抱煤炭
item.description:
激增的产量不仅仅是为了满足需求，更是为了确保永不短缺。【原文：

Surging production isn’t merely about meeting demand, it’s making sure there’s never a shortage.

】

item.title: 德国经济步履蹒跚，房地产市场复苏受阻
item.description: 房地产经纪商仲量联行公司（Jones Lang LaSalle Inc.【原文：A deteriorating economic outlook thwarted the up-tick in German real estate transactions investors had hoped for at the beginning of the year, real estate broker Jones Lang LaSalle Inc. said.】

item.title: 汉斯的安宁顿在军事遗产出售后旨在重组债务
item.description: Guy Hands 的 Annington Funding Plc 计划将出售军用住宅所得的部分收益返还给英国政府，用于 "重塑 "其资产负债表，并使目前的债务结构更加合理。【原文：Guy Hands’ Annington Funding Plc plans to use part of the proceeds it receives from a sale of military homes back to the UK government to “reshape” its balance sheet and rationalize the current debt structure.】

item.title: 俄罗斯海运原油量自 10 月份以来下降 11
item.description:
该国的海运流量稳定在每天 300 万桶附近

。【原文：

Country’s seaborne flows stabilize near 3 million barrels a day

】

item.title: 西班牙银行上调 2025 年国内需求增长预测
item.description: 西班牙银行上调了对该国今年和 2025 年经济增长的预测，理由是国内需求前景较好。【原文：The Bank of Spain raised its projections for the country’s economic growth this year and in 2025, citing a better outlook for domestic demand.】

item.title: 分析显示，美国汽车制造商在特朗普关税政策下将面临严峻考验
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁要对加拿大和墨西哥进口商品征收关税，这对美国最大的两个贸易伙伴来说可能只是强硬言论。不过，对于北美汽车行业，尤其是美国生产商来说，像他所主张的那种进口税将带来 "相当大的痛苦"。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump’s threats of tariffs on Canadian and Mexican imports might be merely tough talk to the two largest US trading partners. For the North American auto industry and especially American producers, though, import taxes like the kind he’s espousing would bring “considerable pain.”】

item.title: 游戏玩家不会接受乏善可陈的虚拟现实眼镜
item.description: 谷歌正通过其雄心勃勃的 Android XR 项目重返虚拟现实领域，我真心希望它不会重蹈公司在此类硬件上最常犯的错误。但首先...【原文：Google is getting back into the virtual reality business with its ambitious Android XR project, and I’m seriously hoping it won’t repeat the most common mistake companies make with this class of hardware. But first...】

item.description: 我是驻香港的亚洲经济记者 Katia Dmitrieva。今天我们将关注中国工厂如何为第二次贸易战做准备。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册接收本新闻通讯，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Katia Dmitrieva, Asia economics correspondent in Hong Kong. item.title: MidOcean 为首支 CLO 股权基金融资 3.04 亿美元
item.description: 另类资产管理公司 MidOcean Partners 为其首支基金获得了 3.04 亿美元的资金承诺，该基金将投资于杠杆贷款支持的债券中风险最高的部分。【原文：Alternative asset manager MidOcean Partners has obtained $304 million of capital commitments for its first fund that will invest in the riskiest tranches of bonds backed by leveraged loans.】

item.title: 交易商等待特朗普以 3 万亿美元大单实现反弹
item.description: 并购银行家们在 2024 年重新站了起来，现在正等待着看唐纳德-特朗普的第二任总统任期是会推动还是抑制他们刚刚开始的复苏。【原文：Mergers and acquisitions bankers got back on their feet in 2024 and are now waiting to see whether a second Donald Trump presidency will turbocharge or temper their nascent recovery.】

item.title: 英国将监控新二级市场的内幕交易风险
item.description: 英国监管机构称，与传统的证券交易所相比，新的私人公司股票销售框架将创造一个 "更像'买方当心'的市场"，内幕交易的风险更高。【原文：A UK regulator said a new framework for private company share sales will create “more of a ‘buyer beware’ market” than a traditional stock exchange, with higher risks of insider trading.】

item.title: 刚果起诉苹果公司，指控其产品 "掠夺 "矿产
item.description: 刚果民主共和国在法国和比利时对苹果公司提起诉讼。在这些诉讼中，刚果民主共和国指控苹果公司在其产品中使用了从非洲中部国家 "掠夺 "来的矿产。【原文：The Democratic Republic of Congo filed lawsuits against Apple Inc. in France and Belgium. In them, it accuses the company of using minerals “pillaged” from the central African nation in its products.】

item.title: 德国经济的问题出在哪里？
item.description: 当欧洲项目遇到困难时，无论是在 2010-2012 年的主权债务危机期间，还是在十年后的大流行病期间，该地区通常都可以依靠德国雄厚的资金来帮助解决问题。【原文：At times when the European project ran into trouble — during the sovereign debt crisis of 2010-2012, or the pandemic a decade later — the region could usually rely on Germany’s deep pockets to help fix the problem.】

item.title: 巴西央行警告物价前景显著恶化
item.description: 巴西央行表示，由于货币疲软和需求回升等因素，通胀风险正在显现，这迫使央行董事会一致发出信号，借贷成本将在 3 月前升至 14% 以上。【原文：Brazil’s central bank said inflation risks are materializing due to factors including a weaker currency and resilient demand, forcing the board to signal unanimously that borrowing costs will rise past 14% by March.】

item.title: 大众汽车的工会问题仍未解决，谈判陷入僵局
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，大众汽车公司管理层和工会领导人仍远未达成协议，双方就裁员和关闭工厂的提议进行了第二天的谈判。【原文：Volkswagen AG’s management and labor leaders remain far from a deal as the two sides hunkered down for a second day of negotiations over proposed layoffs and factory closures, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 海湾地区的消费文化吸引银行和私人信贷进入该地区
item.description: 由于主权财富基金将大量资金投入海外，海湾地区各国政府一直在努力将投资引入本土。这是一场艰苦的战斗，但全球贷款机构正在注意到一个利基领域：消费贷款。【原文：Governments in the Gulf have been fighting to bring investment onshore, as sovereign wealth funds invest vast sums of money abroad. It’s been an uphill battle, but global lenders are taking notice of one niche area: consumer loans.】

item.title: 乌克兰铁路公司债券在要求延迟支付后大幅下跌
item.description: 乌克兰国营铁路公司 Ukrzaliznytsia 发行的美元债券周二下跌，因为该公司要求债券持有人推迟支付部分利息。【原文：Dollar bonds issued by Ukraine’s state-run railway company Ukrzaliznytsia fell on Tuesday after the company asked bondholders to delay some interest payments.】

item.title: 贝森特看来将在 2025 年面对倔强的债券投资者
item.description: 2025 年会出现财政危机吗？【原文：Could 2025 be the year for fiscal crises?】

item.title: 监管主管布赫表示，欧洲央行寻求加快 SRT 审批速度
item.description: 欧洲央行监管主管克劳迪娅-布赫（Claudia Buch）表示，欧洲央行将对重大风险转移试行加速审批程序，这有可能使交易对银行更具吸引力。【原文：The European Central Bank is set to trial an accelerated approval process for significant risk transfers, potentially making the deals more attractive for banks, supervision head Claudia Buch said.】

item.title: 美国电力行业能否满足人工智能对能源的巨大需求？
item.description:
由于人工智能的发展，全国各地的数据中心如雨后春笋般涌现。但是，所有这些能源使用所带来的气候代价非常高昂。【原文：

Thanks to AI, data centers are popping up across the country. But the climate price for all this energy use is steep.

】

item.title: Booking 首席财务官称通胀影响仍在抑制美国旅游需求
item.description: Booking Holdings Inc.表示，通货膨胀的影响仍在抑制美国的旅游需求，对价格敏感的消费者需要等待更长时间才能计划假期。【原文：Booking Holdings Inc. says the impact of inflation is still dampening travel demand in the US, with price-conscious consumers waiting longer to plan vacations.】

item.title: 欧盟对 TikTok 在罗马尼亚选举干扰中的作用展开调查
item.description: 欧盟对 TikTok 提起诉讼，怀疑它没有采取足够措施阻止虚假账户和外国参与者干扰罗马尼亚上个月的选举。【原文：The European Union opened proceedings against TikTok over suspicions that it didn’t do enough to stop fake accounts and foreign actors from interfering with the Romanian elections last month.】

item.title: 法官暗示德国电网运营商将输掉利率之争
item.description: 德国的能源网络运营商在争取提高国内电网投资的规定股本回报率的斗争中面临打击，因为德国最高民事法庭表示，它可能会站在监管这些费率的机构一边。【原文：Germany’s energy network operators are facing a blow in their fight to increase the regulated return on equity for grid investments in the country, after the nation’s top civil court indicated it’s likely to side with the agency regulating these rates.】

item.title: 从毛里求斯到莫桑比克，"奇多 "气旋造成死亡和破坏
item.description: 在印度洋西南部的一连串岛屿上，救援人员正在争分夺秒地抢救生命，修复热带气旋 "千岛湖 "造成的破坏。【原文：Rescue workers are racing to save lives and repair damage wrought by Tropical Cyclone Chido in a string of islands across the southwestern Indian Ocean.】

item.title: 美银美林称现金持有量暴跌后股票闪现卖出信号
item.description: 基金经理们一直在减少现金持有量，将其降至历史新低，并将资金投入美国股市，这引发了美国银行（Bank of America Corp.【原文：Fund managers have been reducing cash holdings to a record low and pouring money into US stocks, triggering a metric that Bank of America Corp. says could be a signal to sell global equities.】

item.title: Broadcom 的 "Nvidia 时刻 "已经到来。现在它需要交付
item.description: 博通公司（Broadcom Inc. ）在上周财报发布后的大涨让人不禁想起 2023 年英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.这家芯片制造商现在需要证明，它能继续成为人工智能时代的另一个巨头。【原文：Broadcom Inc.’s massive rally after last week’s earnings report is reminiscent of when Nvidia Corp. shares first started to take off back in 2023. The chipmaker now needs to prove it can follow through to become another giant of the artificial intelligence era.】

item.title: 瑞士议会批准禁止真主党的提案
item.description: 瑞士议会批准了一项禁止黎巴嫩民兵组织真主党的提案，称其为准军事恐怖组织。【原文：Switzerland’s parliament approved a proposal to ban Lebanese militia group Hezbollah, describing it as a paramilitary terrorist organization.】

item.title: 土耳其 Sahenk 公司为伊斯坦布尔港签署 11 亿美元债务重组协议
item.description: 土耳其大亨费里特-萨亨克（Ferit Sahenk）的 Dogus 集团已与债权人签署协议，将重组与伊斯坦布尔旗舰邮轮港口和购物中心项目相关的超过 10.2 亿欧元（11 亿美元）的债务。【原文：Turkish tycoon Ferit Sahenk’s Dogus Group has signed a deal with creditors to restructure over €1.02 billion ($1.1 billion) in debt tied to its flagship Istanbul cruise port and shopping center project.】

item.title: 土耳其市场监察机构为股票限制和高速交易辩护
item.description: 土耳其最高市场监管机构驳斥了将取消大流行病时期交易限制的猜测，称这些措施对市场稳定至关重要。【原文：Turkey’s top market regulator dismissed speculation that pandemic-era trading limits will be lifted, calling the measures vital for market stability.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡经济增长 5.5%，债务重组接近尾声
item.description: 斯里兰卡上一季度经济增长了 5.5%，这提振了人们的情绪，因为该国正在寻求完成债务重组，这对保持国际货币基金组织的援助畅通至关重要。【原文：Sri Lanka’s economy grew 5.5% last quarter, boosting sentiment as the nation looks to finalize debt restructuring that’s crucial to keep the International Monetary Fund’s aid flowing.】
